I seem to recall a reference to something like this on the nLab but I can't find it:

Suppose X is some class of colimits closed under composition - e.g. a finite colimit of finite colimits is a finite colimit. Then the 'free category with X-colimits' on a category C is the full subcategory of the presheaf category on C consisting of X-colimits of representables.

Does anyone know where this has been precisely stated and proved?
I happen to need it in just two cases: where X is 'finite colimits' and where X is 'finite coproducts'.
Great, thanks! That terrifying book... okay, good, that theorem statement looks locally comprehensible.

Excellent, that's just what I need!

By the way, all I needed was this: a proof that

  • the free category with finite coproducts on a set XXX (= a small discrete category)

is the same as

  • the free category with finite colimits on XXX

and that both are equivalent to the category of finite sets over the set XXX. This should do the job.

I just needed this fact for something....
